required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A 9 Week, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Multicenter, Study Of Pregabalin (BID) In Subject With Posttraumatic Peripheral Neuropathic Pain

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the efficacy of pregabalin compared to placebo in the treatment of posttraumatic peripheral neuropathic pain

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Weekly Mean Pain Score at End of Treatment (Week 8) From Daily Pain Diary
primary_outcome.description: Daily Pain Diary scale : mean score from 11-point numerical scale of pain; range: 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst possible pain). Endpoint weekly mean pain score: mean of the last 7 available pain scores from a daily pain diary during double blind treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) Anxiety Score
secondary_outcome.description: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale Anxiety Score (HADS-A) consists of 7 items that are assessed by a score of 0 = no anxiety to 3 = severe feeling of anxiety. The anxiety subscale determines a state of generalized anxiety (including anxious mood, restlessness, anxious thoughts, panic attacks). Score range = 0 to 21; higher scores indicate a greater intensity of anxiety

secondary_outcome.measure: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) Depression Score
secondary_outcome.description: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale Depression Score (HADS-D) consists of 7 items that are assessed by a score of 0 = no depression to 3 = severe feeling of depression. The depression subscale focuses on the state of lost interest and diminished pleasure response ("lowering of hedonic tone"). Score range = 0 to 21; higher scores indicate a greater intensity of depression

secondary_outcome.measure: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) Anxiety Score - FAS Subset With Moderate/Severe Baseline Scores
secondary_outcome.description: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale Anxiety Score (HADS-A) consists of 7 items that are assessed by a score of 0 = no anxiety to 3 = severe feeling of anxiety. The anxiety subscale determines a state of generalized anxiety (including anxious mood, restlessness, anxious thoughts, panic attacks). Score range = 0 to 21; higher scores indicate a greater intensity of anxiety.

secondary_outcome.measure: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) Depression Score - FAS Subset With Moderate/Severe Baseline Scores
secondary_outcome.description: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS-D) consists of 7 items that are assessed by a score of 0 = no depression to 3 = severe feeling of depression. The depression subscale focuses on the state of lost interest and diminished pleasure response (lowering of hedonic tone). Score range = 0 to 21; higher scores indicate a greater intensity of depression

secondary_outcome.measure: Weekly Mean Pain Score From Daily Pain Diary
secondary_outcome.description: Daily Pain Diary scale : mean score from 11-point numerical scale of pain; range:0 (no pain) to 10 (worst possible pain). Mean of scores available for each week.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With 30% and 50% Response in Weekly Mean Daily Pain Rating Score (DPRS) From Baseline Until Endpoint (Week 8)
secondary_outcome.description: Based on weekly mean daily pain rating score (DPRS), responders were defined as subjects with a >= 30% and >=50% reduction in weekly mean scores from baseline until endpoint (Week 8). Endpoint was calculated as the mean of the last 7 available pain scores from the daily pain diary while in the double-blind treatment phase.

secondary_outcome.measure: Weekly Mean Sleep Interference Score
secondary_outcome.description: 11-point numerical scale with which the patient describes pain interference with sleep over past 24 hours; range: 0 (pain does not interfere with sleep) to 10 (pain completely interferes with sleep). Endpoint weekly mean score: mean of last 7 available scores from daily sleep interference diary during double-blind treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Medical Outcome Study (MOS) Sleep Subscales
secondary_outcome.description: Medical Outcome Study (MOS) is a patient-rated questionnaire consisting of 12 items that assess key constructs of sleep (7 subscales as well as a 9-item overall sleep problems index. MOS-Sleep Scale is scored from 0 to 100. A higher score indicates more disturbance.

secondary_outcome.measure: Medical Outcome Study (MOS) Optimal Sleep
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects responding to have had optimal sleep. Optimal sleep is 1 item in the Medical Outcome Study (MOS)sleep scale, a patient-reported measure consisting of twelve items that assess the key constructs of sleep. Subjects were asked to recall sleep-related activities over the past week.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Global Impression of Change (PGIC)
secondary_outcome.description: Patient Global Impression of Change (PGIC): a patient-rated instrument that measures change in patient's overall status on a 7-point scale; range: 1 Very Much Improved to 7 Very Much Worse.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Global Impression of Change (CGIC)
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical Global Impression of Change (CGIC): clinician's judgment of overall change in the patient's condition over a defined period on a 7-point scale; range: 1 Very Much Improved to 7 Very Much Worse.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Treatment Satisfaction Scale (PTSS): Impact of Current Pain Medication
secondary_outcome.description: Pain Treatment Satisfaction Scale (PTSS); Impact of Current Pain Medication: measure of patient satisfaction with treatment for acute or chronic pain. Response range: 1 (strongly agree) to 5 (strongly disagree). Mean scores were calculated and transformed onto a scale of 0-100, range: 0 = worst possible satisfaction to 100 = best possible satisfaction with pain treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Treatment Satisfaction Scale (PTSS): Satisfaction With Current Pain Medication
secondary_outcome.description: Pain Treatment Satisfaction Scale (PTSS); Satisfaction with Current Pain Medication: measure of patient satisfaction with treatment for acute or chronic pain. Response range:1 (strongly agree) to 5 (strongly disagree). Mean scores were calculated and transformed onto a scale of 0-100, range: 0 = worst possible satisfaction to 100 = best possible satisfaction with pain treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Treatment Satisfaction Scale (PTSS): Medication Characteristics
secondary_outcome.description: Pain Treatment Satisfaction Scale (PTSS); Medication Characteristics: measure of patient satisfaction with treatment for acute or chronic pain. Response range: 1 (strongly agree) to 5 (strongly disagree). Mean scores were calculated and transformed onto a scale of 0-100, range: 0 = worst possible satisfaction to 100 = best possible satisfaction with pain treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Treatment Satisfaction Scale (PTSS): Efficacy
secondary_outcome.description: Pain Treatment Satisfaction Scale (PTSS); Efficacy: measure of patient satisfaction with treatment for acute or chronic pain. Response range: 1 (strongly agree) to 5 (strongly disagree). Mean scores were calculated and transformed onto a scale of 0-100, range: 0 = worst possible satisfaction to 100 = best possible satisfaction with pain treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Modified Brief Pain Inventory Short Form (m-BPI-sf)
secondary_outcome.description: Modified Brief Pain Inventory Short Form (m-BPI-sf): self-administered questionnaire to assess severity of pain (measured by 4 items)and impact of pain on daily functions (measured by 7 items)in past 24 hours. Items are rated on an 11-point scale ranging from 0 to 10, with higher scores indicating greater pain and/or interference due to pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Neuropathic Pain Symptom Inventory (NPSI) Total Intensity Score
secondary_outcome.description: Neuropathic Pain Symptom Inventory (NPSI) includes 10 descriptors (scale 0-10) of different pain symptoms & 2 temporal items assessing the duration of spontaneous ongoing and paroxysmal pain. A total intensity score is calculated by sub grouping the questions into five pain dimensions, summing the five sub groups, and converting into a percentage.

secondary_outcome.measure: Medical Outcome Study Cognitive Subscale (MOS-Cog); Reasoning
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects' responses to each of the 6 questions on the Medical Outcome Study Cognitive (MOS-Cog) subscale were summarized at baseline and Week 8. Category range: all of the time to none of the time. No formal statistical modeling was used.

secondary_outcome.measure: Medical Outcome Study Cognitive Subscale (MOS-Cog); Concentration
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects' responses to each of the 6 questions on the Medical Outcome Study Cognitive (MOS-Cog) subscale were summarized at baseline and Week 8. Category range: all of the time to none of the time. No formal statistical modeling was used.

secondary_outcome.measure: Medical Outcome Study Cognitive Subscale (MOS-Cog); Confusion
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects' responses to each of the 6 questions on the Medical Outcome Study Cognitive (MOS-Cog) subscale were summarized at baseline and Week 8. Category range: all of the time to none of the time. No formal statistical modeling was used.

secondary_outcome.measure: Medical Outcome Study Cognitive Subscale (MOS-Cog); Memory
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects' responses to each of the 6 questions on the Medical Outcome Study Cognitive (MOS-Cog) subscale were summarized at baseline and Week 8. Category range: all of the time to none of the time. No formal statistical modeling was used.

secondary_outcome.measure: Medical Outcome Study Cognitive Subscale (MOS-Cog); Attention
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects' responses to each of the 6 questions on the Medical Outcome Study Cognitive (MOS-Cog) subscale were summarized at baseline and Week 8. Category range: all of the time to none of the time. No formal statistical modeling was used.

secondary_outcome.measure: Medical Outcome Study Cognitive Subscale (MOS-Cog); Thinking
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects' responses to each of the 6 questions on the Medical Outcome Study Cognitive (MOS-Cog) subscale were summarized at baseline and Week 8. Category range: all of the time to none of the time. No formal statistical modeling was used.

secondary_outcome.measure: Davidson Trauma Scale (DTS): Severity
secondary_outcome.description: Self-rated instrument to measure symptom severity and treatment outcome in post traumatic stress disorder (PTSD). Scale of 17 PTSD symptoms over previous week; frequency scale: 0 (not at all) to 4 (every day), and severity 0 (not at all distressing) to 4(extremely distressing). The total Davidson Trauma Scale score ranges from 0 to 136.

secondary_outcome.measure: Davidson Trauma Scale (DTS): Frequency
secondary_outcome.description: Self-rated instrument to measure symptom severity and treatment outcome in post traumatic stress disorder (PTSD). Scale of 17 PTSD symptoms over previous week; frequency scale: 0 (not at all) to 4 (every day), and severity 0 (not at all distressing) to 4(extremely distressing). The total Davidson Trauma Scale score ranges from 0 to 136.

secondary_outcome.measure: Davidson Trauma Scale (DTS): Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: Self-rated instrument to measure symptom severity and treatment outcome in post traumatic stress disorder (PTSD). Scale of 17 PTSD symptoms over previous week; frequency scale: 0 (not at all) to 4 (every day), and severity 0 (not at all distressing) to 4(extremely distressing). The total Davidson Trauma Scale score ranges from 0 to 136.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of Posttraumatic Peripheral Neuropathic Pain (NeP) syndrome, including post-surgical NeP, NeP due to peripheral nerve injury, and phantom limb pain, confirmed by a qualified pain specialist and persisting for a minimum of 3 months following the traumatic event
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects whose posttraumatic neuropathic pain is due to Complex Regional Pain Syndrome (CRPS, Type I or Type II)
- NeP not due to trauma, and not peripheral pain

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

clinical_study.keyword: Phase 4, post-traumatic neuropathic pain, neuropathic pain, Nep, post surgical pain, nerve injury, phantom limb pain, international

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 2-week screening period and single-blind washout and placebo run-in phase followed by a 4-week randomized, dose adjustment, double-blind treatment phase

group.title: Single-Blind Placebo
group.description: All subjects received placebo capsules for the 2-week screening period, subjects were then randomized to placebo or pregabalin treatment.

group.title: Double-Blind Pregabalin
group.description: Dose adjustment of 150 to 600 mg/day based on tolerability through Visit 5. During the 4-week randomized maintenance phase, subjects maintained the same dosing regimen achieved at the end of the dose adjustment phase until the end of Week 8 (Visit 7). At the completion of the dose maintenance phase, subjects tapered off study medication during a 1-week double-blind taper phase (pregabalin 150 to 300 mg/day).

group.title: Double-Blind Placebo
group.description: Matching placebo through Visit 5. During the 4-week randomized maintenance phase, subjects continued matching placebo until the end of Week 8 (Visit 7) and the 1 week taper phase.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Dose adjustment of 150 to 600 mg/day based on tolerability through Visit 5. During the 4-week randomized maintenance phase, subjects maintained the same dosing regimen achieved at the end of the dose adjustment phase until the end of Week 8 (Visit 7). At the completion of the dose maintenance phase, subjects tapered off study medication during a 1-week double-blind taper phase (pregabalin 150 to 300 mg/day).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching placebo through Visit 5. During the 4-week randomized maintenance phase, subjects continued matching placebo until the end of Week 8 (Visit 7) and the 1 week taper phase.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age, Customized
Gender

outcome.title: Weekly Mean Pain Score at End of Treatment (Week 8) From Daily Pain Diary
outcome.description: Daily Pain Diary scale : mean score from 11-point numerical scale of pain; range: 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst possible pain). Endpoint weekly mean pain score: mean of the last 7 available pain scores from a daily pain diary during double blind treatment.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): all randomized subjects who received >= 1 dose study drug & have post-randomization efficacy data. Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF).

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Dose adjustment of 150 to 600 mg/day based on tolerability through Visit 5. During the 4-week randomized maintenance phase, subjects maintained the same dosing regimen achieved at the end of the dose adjustment phase until the end of Week 8 (Visit 7). At the completion of the dose maintenance phase, subjects tapered off study medication during a 1-week double-blind taper phase (pregabalin 150 to 300 mg/day).

measure.title: Weekly Mean Pain Score at End of Treatment (Week 8) From Daily Pain Diary
measure.description: Daily Pain Diary scale : mean score from 11-point numerical scale of pain; range: 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst possible pain). Endpoint weekly mean pain score: mean of the last 7 available pain scores from a daily pain diary during double blind treatment.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): all randomized subjects who received >= 1 dose study drug & have post-randomization efficacy data. Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF).

analysis.groups_desc: The study is powered to detect a clinically significant difference of 1 between treatment groups in the weekly mean pain score. Null hypothesis was that there was no difference in weekly mean pain scores between pregabalin and placebo.
analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA adjusted for treatment group, baseline mean pain score and pooled country

group.description: Dose adjustment of 150 to 600 mg/day based on tolerability through Visit 5. During the 4-week randomized maintenance phase, subjects maintained the same dosing regimen achieved at the end of the dose adjustment phase until the end of Week 8 (Visit 7). At the completion of the dose maintenance phase, subjects tapered off study medication during a 1-week double-blind taper phase (pregabalin 150 to 300 mg/day).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching placebo through Visit 5. During the 4-week randomized maintenance phase, subjects continued matching placebo until the end of Week 8 (Visit 7) and the 1 week taper phase.

measure.title: Patient Global Impression of Change (PGIC)
measure.description: Patient Global Impression of Change (PGIC): a patient-rated instrument that measures change in patient’s overall status on a 7-point scale; range: 1 Very Much Improved to 7 Very Much Worse.
measure.population: FAS, LOCF

outcome.title: Clinical Global Impression of Change (CGIC)
outcome.description: Clinical Global Impression of Change (CGIC): clinician’s judgment of overall change in the patient’s condition over a defined period on a 7-point scale; range: 1 Very Much Improved to 7 Very Much Worse.
outcome.population: FAS, LOCF

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Dose adjustment of 150 to 600 mg/day based on tolerability through Visit 5. During the 4-week randomized maintenance phase, subjects maintained the same dosing regimen achieved at the end of the dose adjustment phase until the end of Week 8 (Visit 7). At the completion of the dose maintenance phase, subjects tapered off study medication during a 1-week double-blind taper phase (pregabalin 150 to 300 mg/day).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching placebo through Visit 5. During the 4-week randomized maintenance phase, subjects continued matching placebo until the end of Week 8 (Visit 7) and the 1 week taper phase.

measure.title: Clinical Global Impression of Change (CGIC)
measure.description: Clinical Global Impression of Change (CGIC): clinician’s judgment of overall change in the patient’s condition over a defined period on a 7-point scale; range: 1 Very Much Improved to 7 Very Much Worse.
measure.population: FAS, LOCF

outcome.title: Pain Treatment Satisfaction Scale (PTSS): Impact of Current Pain Medication
outcome.description: Pain Treatment Satisfaction Scale (PTSS); Impact of Current Pain Medication: measure of patient satisfaction with treatment for acute or chronic pain. Response range: 1 (strongly agree) to 5 (strongly disagree). Mean scores were calculated and transformed onto a scale of 0-100, range: 0 = worst possible satisfaction to 100 = best possible satisfaction with pain treatment.
outcome.population: FAS, LOCF. Number of subjects with evaluable data (n=pregabalin, placebo), respectively.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Dose adjustment of 150 to 600 mg/day based on tolerability through Visit 5. During the 4-week randomized maintenance phase, subjects maintained the same dosing regimen achieved at the end of the dose adjustment phase until the end of Week 8 (Visit 7). At the completion of the dose maintenance phase, subjects tapered off study medication during a 1-week double-blind taper phase (pregabalin 150 to 300 mg/day).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching placebo through Visit 5. During the 4-week randomized maintenance phase, subjects continued matching placebo until the end of Week 8 (Visit 7) and the 1 week taper phase.

measure.title: Pain Treatment Satisfaction Scale (PTSS): Efficacy
measure.description: Pain Treatment Satisfaction Scale (PTSS); Efficacy: measure of patient satisfaction with treatment for acute or chronic pain. outcome.title: Modified Brief Pain Inventory Short Form (m-BPI-sf)
outcome.description: Modified Brief Pain Inventory Short Form (m-BPI-sf): self-administered questionnaire to assess severity of pain (measured by 4 items)and impact of pain on daily functions (measured by 7 items)in past 24 hours. Items are rated on an 11-point scale ranging from 0 to 10, with higher scores indicating greater pain and/or interference due to pain.
outcome.population: Baseline; FAS, LOCF. Number of subjects with evaluable data: (n = pregabalin, placebo), respectively.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Dose adjustment of 150 to 600 mg/day based on tolerability through Visit 5. During the 4-week randomized maintenance phase, subjects maintained the same dosing regimen achieved at the end of the dose adjustment phase until the end of Week 8 (Visit 7). At the completion of the dose maintenance phase, subjects tapered off study medication during a 1-week double-blind taper phase (pregabalin 150 to 300 mg/day).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching placebo through Visit 5. During the 4-week randomized maintenance phase, subjects continued matching placebo until the end of Week 8 (Visit 7) and the 1 week taper phase.

measure.title: Modified Brief Pain Inventory Short Form (m-BPI-sf)
measure.description: Modified Brief Pain Inventory Short Form (m-BPI-sf): self-administered questionnaire to assess severity of pain (measured by 4 items)and impact of pain on daily functions (measured by 7 items)in past 24 hours. Items are rated on an 11-point scale ranging from 0 to 10, with higher scores indicating greater pain and/or interference due to pain.
measure.population: Baseline; FAS, LOCF. Number of subjects with evaluable data: (n = pregabalin, placebo), respectively.

outcome.title: Neuropathic Pain Symptom Inventory (NPSI) Total Intensity Score
outcome.description: Neuropathic Pain Symptom Inventory (NPSI) includes 10 descriptors (scale 0-10) of different pain symptoms & 2 temporal items assessing the duration of spontaneous ongoing and paroxysmal pain. A total intensity score is calculated by sub grouping the questions into five pain dimensions, summing the five sub groups, and converting into a percentage.
outcome.population: FAS. Number of subjects with a non-missing NPSI Total Intensity Score at Baseline and Week 8 (using LOCF) is 100, 106 for pregabalin, placebo respectively.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Dose adjustment of 150 to 600 mg/day based on tolerability through Visit 5. During the 4-week randomized maintenance phase, subjects maintained the same dosing regimen achieved at the end of the dose adjustment phase until the end of Week 8 (Visit 7). At the completion of the dose maintenance phase, subjects tapered off study medication during a 1-week double-blind taper phase (pregabalin 150 to 300 mg/day).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching placebo through Visit 5. During the 4-week randomized maintenance phase, subjects continued matching placebo until the end of Week 8 (Visit 7) and the 1 week taper phase.

measure.title: Neuropathic Pain Symptom Inventory (NPSI) Total Intensity Score
measure.description: Neuropathic Pain Symptom Inventory (NPSI) includes 10 descriptors (scale 0-10) of different pain symptoms & 2 temporal items assessing the duration of spontaneous ongoing and paroxysmal pain. A total intensity score is calculated by sub grouping the questions into five pain dimensions, summing the five sub groups, and converting into a percentage.
measure.population: FAS. Number of subjects with a non-missing NPSI Total Intensity Score at Baseline and Week 8 (using LOCF) is 100, 106 for pregabalin, placebo respectively.

outcome.title: Medical Outcome Study Cognitive Subscale (MOS-Cog); Reasoning
outcome.description: The number of subjects' responses to each of the 6 questions on the Medical Outcome Study Cognitive (MOS-Cog) subscale were summarized at baseline and Week 8. Category range: all of the time to none of the time. No formal statistical modeling was used.
outcome.population: FAS, LOCF. The number of subjects that answered the question at Week 8 is 120, 121 for pregabalin, placebo respectively.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Dose adjustment of 150 to 600 mg/day based on tolerability through Visit 5. outcome.title: Davidson Trauma Scale (DTS): Severity
outcome.description: Self-rated instrument to measure symptom severity and treatment outcome in post traumatic stress disorder (PTSD). Scale of 17 PTSD symptoms over previous week; frequency scale: 0 (not at all) to 4 (every day), and severity 0 (not at all distressing) to 4(extremely distressing). The total Davidson Trauma Scale score ranges from 0 to 136.
outcome.population: FAS, LOCF. Number of subjects with evaluable data: (n=pregabalin, placebo), respectively.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Dose adjustment of 150 to 600 mg/day based on tolerability through Visit 5. During the 4-week randomized maintenance phase, subjects maintained the same dosing regimen achieved at the end of the dose adjustment phase until the end of Week 8 (Visit 7). At the completion of the dose maintenance phase, subjects tapered off study medication during a 1-week double-blind taper phase (pregabalin 150 to 300 mg/day).

group.title: Single-Blind Placebo
group.description: All subjects received placebo capsules for the 2-week screening period, subjects were then randomized to placebo or pregabalin treatment.

group.title: Double-Blind Pregabalin
group.description: Dose adjustment of 150 to 600 mg/day based on tolerability through Visit 5. During the 4-week randomized maintenance phase, subjects maintained the same dosing regimen achieved at the end of the dose adjustment phase until the end of Week 8 (Visit 7). At the completion of the dose maintenance phase, subjects tapered off study medication during a 1-week double-blind taper phase (pregabalin 150 to 300 mg/day).

group.title: Double-Blind Placebo
group.description: Matching placebo through Visit 5. During the 4-week randomized maintenance phase, subjects continued matching placebo until the end of Week 8 (Visit 7) and the 1 week taper phase.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of < 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), < 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
